title: Constrained-random: generate legal packets quickly (avoid solver nightmares)
description: Random is great â€” until it's painfully slow. Write constraints that prevent illegal packets (e.g., bad addrs, zero data) and explain techniques to keep randomization fast and reliable.

examples.input: class pkt; rand bit [7:0] addr; rand bit [31:0] data; constraint legal {addr inside {[8'h10:8'hEF]};} constraint nonzero {data != 32'h0;} endclass
examples.output: Randomization only produces legal addresses and non-zero data; performance remains reasonable if constraints are simple.
examples.explanation: Simple range constraints are solver-friendly; complex cross constraints can slow randomize().

constraints: Avoid complex solutions that require enumerating large tables; prefer ranges and implications.
hints: Use 'soft' constraints if you need prioritized relaxation.
